title.native: ダンガンロンパ 希望の学園と絶望の高校生 The Animation
title.romaji: Danganronpa: Kibou no Gakuen to Zetsubou no Koukousei - The Animation

description: A group of 15 elite high school students are gathered at a very special, high class high school. To graduate from this high school essentially means you'll succeed in life, but graduating is very difficult. The school is presided over by a bear called Monokuma, and he explains to them that their graduation hinges around committing a murder. The only way to graduate is to kill one of your classmates and get away with it. If the other classmates discover the identity of the killer, the killer is the only one executed. However, if they fail to catch the killer, only the killer graduates and the others are annihilated. Which of the 15 will survive the bloodbath to come?
synonyms: ダンガンロンパ The Animation
Danganronpa: Academy of Hope and High School Students of Despair THE ANIMATION

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

node.description: Nobuyo Ooyama, born Nobuyo Yamashita (山下羨代) was a Japanese retired actress, voice actress, singer, screenwriter, essayist, and TV personality affiliated with Actors Seven. Her husband is late TV personality Keisuke Sagawa. She is best known for voicing the title character in the Doraemon anime series that ran from 1979 to 2005, for 26 years. She also voiced Monokuma, the main villain from the Danganronpa video-game series, from 2010 to 2016 for the first three video games, two Danganronpa stageshows, and Danganronpa: The Animation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/995498317)

Interested in films and comics from his early childhood on. After graduating high school he went to Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and afterwards started working as animator for [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/). After becoming a freelancer for a short time, he joined Logistics where he worked in the software development section and was responsible for animation work and later developing tools for animation work in games. In 2002 he founded [Team Till Dawn](https://anilist.co/studio/6412/), which was also the beginning of his career as anime director.

His hobbies outside of work include bodybuilding, in which he has gone as far as to take part in competitions

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/93473950)

Worked as an assistant to [Shirou Oono](https://anilist.co/staff/132305/) in the late '90s.
Enka singer and occasional voice actress.

name.native: スパイク・チュンソフト

node.description:
[Website](https://www.spike-chunsoft.co.jp/) | [Twitter](https://www.spike-chunsoft.co.jp/)

Spike is a game content planning, developing and managing company. Spike and Chunsoft merged in 2012 as Spike Chunsoft.

Vocaloid producer most notable for arrangement covers.  

[Official website](https://ameblo.jp/suzumusic-0419/entry-12082493915.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzumun)

Vocaloid producer most notable for arrangement covers.  

[Official website](https://ameblo.jp/suzumusic-0419/entry-12082493915.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzumun)

Vocaloid producer most notable for arrangement covers.  

[Official website](https://ameblo.jp/suzumusic-0419/entry-12082493915.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzumun)

Rui Komatsuzaki is best known as the main concept artist of the Danganronpa franchise.

Komatsuzaki was a sculpture graduate before becoming involved with Spike, and Danganronpa was his first experience as a character designer.

(Source: Danganronpa Wiki)

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/KoudenMS)

Masafumi Takada is a japanese composer and sound designer best known for his work on the soundtracks for killer7, God Hand, No More Heroes, and the Earth Defense Force and the Danganronpa series.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kazkodaka/)

A former employee of Spike Chunsoft and the co-founder of Too Kyo Games. He is primarily known for being the creator and scenario writer of the _Danganronpa_ video game series.

**Birthplace:** Los Angeles, California
**Spouse:** Rachel Robinson (2019-)

**Introduction:**
Christopher Bevins, alternatively known as Chris Bevins is an American voice actor, ADR director and script/screenwriter. He is more known for his work as an ADR director at FUNimation Productions in Dallas/Fort Worth, Texas.

**Non-anime roles:**
~!- Dhalsim and Soldier A (David) in "Street Fighter V" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter IV" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter X Tekken" (VG)
- Koga, Brycen and Swimmer in "Pokémon Masters" (VG)
- Legault in "Fire Emblem Heroes" (VG)
- Nadai in "Fist of the North Star: Lost Paradise" (VG)
- Shishiwakamaru in "Yu Yu Hakusho: Dark Tournament" (VG)
- Voice in "FUNimation" (logo bumper)
!~
**Non-anime staff credits:**
~!- Script Adaptation for "Sengoku Basara: Samurai Heroes" (VG)!~

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.
